speaker: Skyline
text: A helicopter rises above the buildings.  _ACT 1  Scene 1 - Frasier's apartment. It is Daphne's birthday party.  Daphne, Martin, and Mrs. Moon are seated at the table, with Frasier and Niles standing behind them. Daphne leans in to blow out the candle on a cake.  All applaud._

speaker: Niles
text: Yay!  Did you make a wish, sweetheart?

speaker: Gertrude
text: Of course she did!  She wished her father still loved his children enough to call his only daughter on her birthday! [_She rises and moves to the couch._] Or his wife.  Oh, but that's a man for you.  Once he's planted his seed and you've borne his spawn, he moves on to spread his filth elsewhere!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_attempting to divert the subject_] Sounds like a toast to me! I'll get the champagne.

speaker: Martin
text: I'll just have a beer.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I'm not so sure we should introduce alcohol into the situation...

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Daphne, why don't you open your presents.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, that's a good idea!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, here, mine and Dad's first.

speaker: Frasier
text: Happy birthday, Daphne!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, it's a journal!  Oh, it's lovely.  Thank you.

speaker: Martin
text: You don't need to say that for my benefit.  I wanted to get you one of those robot dogs.  You know, something you could really use.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Niles.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Thank you.  Sorry I'm late. [_Niles takes her coat._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no, not at all.  Daphne's just opening her gifts.

speaker: Roz
text: [_rushing to the coffee table_] Here's mine!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Roz, you didn't have to get me anything!

speaker: Roz
text: Don't be silly.  Happy birthday.

speaker: Daphne
text: Ooh...

speaker: Niles
text: We love it!

speaker: Roz
text: Yes, Roger loved black lace.  But he didn't get to see me in it... [_recovering_] Black lace, I mean.  I bought this one for you - new!

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank you, Roz.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Some man break your heart, did he?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, yeah, but I'll be OK.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Sure you will.  Until you realize he was the love of your life and he's gone for good.  Then not a night will pass when you don't beg the good Lord to take you in your sleep.

speaker: Niles
text: [_with biting sarcasm_] We all have those thoughts.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_irritated_] Niles, can I see you in the kitchen, please?

speaker: Niles
text: [_obediently, but poutingly_] Yeah. _They rise and exit, Niles following Daphne like a puppy.  Roz picks up the journal._

speaker: Roz
text: What's this?

speaker: Martin
text: Heh-heh.  That's what I said.  I can tell you what it isn't.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, would you let it go?

speaker: Daphne
text: I know she's difficult, but we need to be sensitive with Mum right now.

speaker: Niles
text: "Difficult?"  I yearn for the days of Difficult.  Difficult was a picnic.  I keep a picture of Difficult in a heart- shaped frame next to my bed.  Difficult was a...

speaker: Daphne
text: [_cutting him off_] All right, Niles, I know!  But it's harder for her now.  I think she's finally realizing that Dad's not coming back.  I guess I am too.

speaker: Niles
text: [_sympathetically_] I'm sorry.  I will be more patient with her.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank you, Niles.

speaker: Gertrude
text: [_to Roz_] And if you do it right, he'll bleed from the inside and no one will know it was you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Daphne!  I think there's still an unopened gift left for you.

speaker: Martin
text: There's an unopened gift for me in the fridge. [_Rising, to Niles_] Try and stop me!

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne. [_Handing her his gift._] Happy birthday, darling!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_excitedly_] Oh, Niles, it's a trip!

speaker: Niles
text: This weekend.  You and I are jetting off to Hawaii for a five-star Polynesian retreat.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, how exciting!  Oh, thank you. [_They kiss._]

speaker: Niles
text: The first day, we are being taken by outrigger to an exclusive island for a private luau.

speaker: Roz
text: Roger and I were supposed to go back to Wisconsin this weekend for my family reunion.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, that's lovely! [_eager, barely noticing Roz_] And the second day, we're going to take a cruise to Molokai.

speaker: Roz
text: Of course, you can't go to Wisconsin without taking a couple of cheese tours.

speaker: Niles
text: [_completely missing the point_] Well, you sure can't, no. And then we're in Molokai, we're going to go snorkeling with the sea tortoise.

speaker: Roz
text: And then, the Dells - Roger really wanted to ride one of those big duck boats.

speaker: Gertrude
text: [_gets up_] I've heard enough.  All these lovey-dovey stories about traveling and romance.  And then you with your birthday! Can't you all see that I'm hurting?  I can't hide it anymore! _She exits to the powder room.  All are taken aback by her speech. Daphne walks to the cake and lights the candle again._

speaker: Niles
text: What are you doing?

speaker: Daphne
text: I want to change my wish.  _She blows out the candle.  FADE OUT_  **AND SHE'S THE CARROTS**  _Scene 2 - Frasier's apartment, later that evening. Roz and Frasier are the only ones remaining.  They are cleaning up._

speaker: Roz
text: I started the dishwasher.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks, Roz, I'll see you tomorrow.

speaker: Roz
text: Do you want me to run the vacuum cleaner?

speaker: Frasier
text: No thanks, I can do it in the morning.

speaker: Roz
text: Are you sure?  I mean, it would just take a second.

speaker: Frasier
text: You don't want to go home, do you?

speaker: Roz
text: Not really.  Alice is in Wisconsin with her grandmother, and it's just hard to face an empty house.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'll tell you what, Roz.  Why don't you sit down and we'll shoot the breeze for a while.

speaker: Roz
text: And when I think about this trip to Wisconsin, I just dread going without Roger.  My family thinks I'm a total loser as it is.  Now I'm just going to prove them right.  "Roz is a failure at love."  "Roz can't find a man."

speaker: Frasier
text: They don't really say that, do they?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, you haven't met my perfect sister, Denise.  I mean, I love her and everything, but she's a total bitch.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, I-I could go with you.

speaker: Roz
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Sure, for moral support.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, is that how you want to spend your vacation?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know.  It just might be the perfect time for me to see a giant duck and a lot of cheese.

speaker: Roz
text: Thank you, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: You want to watch some TV, maybe we can find a good movie?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah! [_Frasier turns on the TV._] Yeah, ever since this whole Roger thing happened, you've really come through for me.  It means a lot.  Why can't more men be like you?  I mean, you are exactly what women are looking for.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah.  Women I date don't seem to know that.

speaker: Roz
text: Some women don't know what's good for them.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_dejectedly_] Terrific.  I'm the broccoli of dating. _Roz laughs.  They relax and watch TV.  They are very comfortable and casual together, far more so than usual.  DISSOLVE TO:  Scene 3 - The following morning. Frasier's bedroom.  We see a close-up of Frasier lying next to someone. The camera moves out to reveal a sleeping Roz, looking very satisfied, cuddled under Frasier's arm.  You are reading this correctly!  Frasier awakens, sees Roz, and suddenly looks uneasy and shocked.  Roz then awakens as well, is highly embarrassed, and slides out of the bed, taking the sheet with her and lifting Frasier's arm to escape.  Roz walks nervously behind the bed and toward the bathroom._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_uneasily_] Morning.

speaker: Roz
text: [_quickly, shouting_] Morning!

speaker: Frasier
text: Can I get you some coffee?

speaker: Roz
text: [_from the bathroom_] I would love to stay, but no.  I've really got to run.  I got the tile guy coming.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_struggling for words_] Right.  So this is a little strange, huh?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, it is.  But good strange!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah.

speaker: Roz
text: You know.  Tile guy. [_She returns the sheet to the bed._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, yeah, I'll get up.

speaker: Roz
text: No! _It is too late.  Frasier has risen and begun to put on his bathrobe. He didn't bother to cover himself before doing this.  This makes Roz even more uneasy._

speaker: Roz
text: Okay.  I really have to go.  I'll see you at work.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, you okay?

speaker: Roz
text: Everything's super!

speaker: Frasier
text: Maybe we should talk about this.

speaker: Roz
text: And we will!  Just not right now, 'cause I'm really late. You know, I mean for the tile guy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Let me walk you out. _CUT TO: Living Room Roz runs out to the living room, grabs her coat, picks up her purse from the coffee table, and races to the door.  Frasier follows._

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, maybe we could have dinner later.

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, and we can talk then.  I mean, not that I really need to talk because I'm fine.  Unless you're not fine. _She is obviously not fine.  She fumbles with her purse and coat and puts on the other boot, rapidly and nervously._

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, I'm fine.  A little strange, though, huh?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, but good strange!

speaker: Martin
text: [_heard from the kitchen_] Damn it, Eddie, just because I dropped something it doesn't make it yours! _As Frasier turns in panic towards the sound of Martin's voice, Roz rushes out.  He turns back round and sees her gone._

speaker: Frasier
text: God, what have I done?  What have I done?  What have I done?

speaker: Martin
text: [_entering_] Morning, Fras.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_recovering, casually_] Morning, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: You see the paper yet?

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, no I haven't.

speaker: Martin
text: Big story about how Roz's purse spent the night on the coffee table. _He sits at the dining table.  Frasier takes some time to react in horror to this.  Martin grins._

speaker: Frasier
text: It's not what it looks like.

speaker: Martin
text: I know that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, what do you mean "you know that?"  Shows what you know, it's exactly what it looks like!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I knew that!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, anyway, it's none of your business, so I'm not discussing it with you. [_then_] Oh, Dad, I've done a terrible thing.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, geez, what happened?  And don't tell me too much.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I-I don't even know how this happened.  She was lonely. She probably thinks I took advantage of her, I mean, that's why she ran out of here.  Do you think I did?

speaker: Martin
text: Fras, you're both adults.  Where's the harm?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you can't be serious, Dad!  I mean, do you realize what this means?  I have probably destroyed our friendship.  Do you know what she'll see every time she looks at me?

speaker: Martin
text: Your naked body.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear God!  I was going to say "someone who's betrayed her trust," but oh, dear God!

speaker: Martin
text: Now, Frasier, don't get all worked up.  When are you supposed to see her next?

speaker: Frasier
text: We're meeting for dinner tonight.

speaker: Martin
text: So everything's normal.  You're going to feel weird and stupid for a while, and then you'll have a big laugh about it and move on.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, you-you're probably right.  I mean, we're adults.  We can discuss this.  We're going to be fine.  Well, we'd better be.  I told her I'd go to Wisconsin with her.

speaker: Martin
text: Wow, you really were lonely.

speaker: Daphne
text: I want to go on this trip as much as you do, but we can't leave Mum alone for a week right now. She seems unbalanced.

speaker: Niles
text: [_helping her off with her jacket_] Well, well, maybe she could stay here with Frasier and Dad.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_reacting quickly and excitedly_] Whoa! Whoa!  What are we talking about?

speaker: Daphne
text: It's Mum again.  She's been crying non-stop since we left here last night.

speaker: Martin
text: Sounds like a job for the prescription pad, Niles.

speaker: Daphne
text: I can't even get Dad on the phone.  He doesn't even know I'm engaged.  I guess I can forget about him walking me down the aisle.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello?  Roz, hi.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, hang on one sec.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, I have a solution.  I want you to use those tickets and take your mother to Hawaii.

speaker: Daphne
text: Are you out of your mind?

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, no, we are going to have a lifetime of romantic trips, but right now what's important is taking care of your mom. Like you said, she's fragile.

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles, that's very thoughtful, but I don't want to go to Hawaii with my Mom.  I want to go with you.

speaker: Niles
text: Just hear me out!

speaker: Martin
text: Are you really going to let that old bat manipulate you out of a trip to Hawaii?

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, I have a plan.

speaker: Martin
text: Niles, you're a sucker.  You know Mrs. Moon's so-called knee injury?  Well, last night I noticed her limping on the wrong leg.

speaker: Niles
text: I know.  She switches.

speaker: Martin
text: How's Roz?

speaker: Frasier
text: She's fleeing the city, thank you.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on!

speaker: Frasier
text: She's going to Wisconsin without me.  She's leaving immediately.  I told you this was going to happen. Our friendship is in ruins.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: What do you mean, "yeah?"

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I kind of thought that might happen.  I was just trying to make you feel better.  _As he philosophically sips his coffee, we:  FADE OUT.  END OF ACT I  ACT II  Scene 4 - Martin has driven Frasier, Niles, Daphne, and Gertrude to the airport.  They pull up inside a parking garage.  Daphne, Gertrude, and Niles exit the car._

speaker: Niles
text: Now remember, when you arrive, a car will be waiting to take you to the Nanehalaka Ha'e Alahe House.

speaker: Gertrude
text: I don't know why we can't go somewhere where they speak English!

speaker: Daphne
text: They do speak English in Hawaii, Mum.

speaker: Martin
text: [_smugly_] How come you can fly to Hawaii, but you can't fly to England?

speaker: Gertrude
text: How come you can drive your car, but you can't do your own laundry?

speaker: Martin
text: [_biting his tongue_] Have a good trip.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank you again Niles. [_They kiss._] I love you.

speaker: Niles
text: I love you too.  I wish I could walk you to the gate, but security...

speaker: Gertrude
text: Yeah, well, we'd better hurry if we're going to pass Customs.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_exasperated and weary_] It's the _same_ country, Mum. [_to Niles_] I'm going to miss you so much!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, God, I know. [_They kiss again._] _Gertrude and Daphne exit.  Niles surreptitiously grabs a small suitcase from the trunk and climbs in the back seat._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sarcastically_] Well, that's going to be a good time.

speaker: Niles
text: I do feel a little guilty, but it's for a greater good.

speaker: Martin
text: Where to, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Virgin Atlantic.  It's right there.

speaker: Frasier
text: What's this?  You're going somewhere?

speaker: Niles
text: England.  I'm going to find Daphne's father and bring him back here if I have to check every pub in Manchester.

speaker: Frasier
text: You can't be serious.

speaker: Martin
text: "I can't do my own laundry because I can't carry the basket said!

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne wants to get her parents back together.  I'm going to try to make that happen.  At the very least, he's going to walk her down that aisle.  It'll be the biggest surprise anyone ever gave her.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's a beautiful gesture, Niles.

speaker: Martin
text: Bye.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why didn't you tell me he was going to England?

speaker: Martin
text: Same reason I didn't tell him you were going to Wisconsin. Which way?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, right. [_checks his ticket_] Concourse "B."

speaker: Martin
text: You think this is a smart plan, surprising Roz in front of her family?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what else would you suggest I do, Dad?  I couldn't reach her by phone.  Roz and I have got to talk before this turns into a permanent divide in our friendship.

speaker: Martin
text: Okay, but you know what she's going to see when she looks at you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, I know, my naked body.  I'll have you know there are worse states...

speaker: Martin
text: All right, just stop this!  I've got enough horror shows in my head.  Here we are.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.  Oh, by the way, Dad.  I got you a little something to keep you company while I'm away.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, no way! The robot dog!  Thanks, son.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sure.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, good, you got the girl one so it won't fight with Eddie.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_wearily_] Dad, it's not a girl.  That's where the batteries go.  _Frasier exits the car.  Martin admires the robot dog.  FADE TO:  Scene 5 - Roz's family home somewhere in Wisconsin. Roz's sister Denise opens the door to reveal Frasier.  Denise is a wholesome-looking, clean-cut young woman, whose cheerfulness is saccharine and very artificial._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, um, I'm looking for Roz Doyle.

speaker: Denise
text: Oh, well, she's out shopping with her cousin right now, but come in!  I'm her sister, Denise.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, it's a pleasure to meet you.

speaker: Denise
text: Oh, likewise.  All we've been hearing is "Roger this" and Roger that," but we've seen no Roger.  We were beginning to think that you didn't really exist.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm afraid you've made a mistake, you see...

speaker: Denise
text: Well, obviously we did, but you can't blame us.  It wouldn't be the first time that she's made up a boyfriend.  We've really been having a lot of fun with her. _She laughs.  Frasier sees what Roz hates and dreads about her sister, and decides to play along._

speaker: Denise
text: Oh, honey, look.  Roger is here.  There really is one!

speaker: Craig
text: Well, I'll be a son of a gun.  Good to know you.  Craig Dawson, Met-Life.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shaking hands_] Hi, Roger... Hammerstein!

speaker: Denise
text: Well, come on in and meet everyone.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thank you.

speaker: Denise
text: Roger, this is Aunt Pearl and Cousin Curtis, and Great Uncle Olaf. _Frasier says hellos all around.  The family mills about and observes him._

speaker: Craig
text: Well, honey, it looks like you owe Roz an apology.

speaker: Denise
text: Oh, now, she knows I was just teasing her.  I'm just relieved that she's finally found someone.  We just want her to have the kind of happiness that we've found.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, I intend to do everything in my power to give her just that.  I love Roz, and I intend to prove it to her.  That's why I've come. _Behind his back, Roz has entered during this last speech.  For one frozen moment, she wonders if Frasier has fallen for her after their night of passion._

speaker: Roz
text: Oh my God, what's going on?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_surprised and embarrassed_] Roz...

speaker: Denise
text: Roger, can Craig fix you a drink?

speaker: Roz
text: [_pausing_] Roger?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, sweetheart, hi! [_He moves to embrace Roz._] I'd love that drink. [_kisses her_]

speaker: Denise
text: Well, well, well.  It looks like you've really made an impression on Roger here, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah.

speaker: Denise
text: How did you two meet again?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, gosh, well, it's the cutest story.  Oh, come on, honey, sit down. _He sits her down on the couch next to him.  Roz smiles uneasily, but she is clearly rather pleased with this turn of events._

speaker: Frasier
text: Um, it all started when... Alice used to wave at me when I was driving my trash-collecting truck.

speaker: Denise
text: Oh, well, I guess Alice is sure going to be happy to see you again.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_off Roz's look_] Oh, well, you know, it's funny, as well as Alice and I get along, she always mistakes me for Roz's boss. It's weird, isn't it?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, yeah!

speaker: Craig
text: Here we are.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Craig
text: So Roger, I hear you're a big golfer.  What do you shoot?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, actually, since I've met Roz, I don't get much time for golf.

speaker: Denise
text: Well, don't get too used to that, Roz.  I've been a golf widow ever since I've been married.  It's like a disease with them.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, maybe with most men, but not with me.  I mean, my spare time is precious, so I like to spend it with the people that I love, like Roz and Alice, and who knows, maybe someday some more little ones. _He has been looking lovingly at Roz.  She returns the very real sentiment, despite the charade.  He picks up a picture frame._

speaker: Frasier
text: Especially if they look like this here.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, my... I hated that picture.  Big ugly glasses and... I guess I was trying to look like Dorothy Hamil.

speaker: Denise
text: We warned you not to get that haircut, but you insisted.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, if I'd met this girl in the fifth grade, I wouldn't have dated anybody else.  Gosh, can I get a copy of this for my desk at work?

speaker: Denise
text: You have a desk?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dashboard.  _They all laugh.  Roz's family is quite taken with "Roger."  FADE TO:  Scene 6 - Frasier's apartment. Eddie is looking suspiciously at the robot dog, which is not moving. Martin is on the phone._

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I looked at the "getting started" section.  Yeah, I did that.  Voice activation?  Yeah, I did everything it said.

speaker: Martin
text: "Appendix B?"  Where is Appendix B?  I just want this damn thing to do some tricks. _Eddie barks again.  The robot dog responds by bending down its front legs and wagging its tail._

speaker: Martin
text: Can't you make this easier?  You know, you shouldn't have to be a rocket scientist to play with some stupid toy. [_Eddie barks and the dog stands upright again._] Eddie, be quiet, I'm on the phone. _The robot dog starts to dance for Eddie.  Martin does not see it.  FADE TO:  Scene 7 - The Doyle family house. It is a bit later.  Frasier is continuing to charm the family as Roger."_

speaker: Frasier
text: So this one's getting tired.  She wants to turn around and head back up the beach, when finally she sees the blanket surrounded by candles, and the food and the wine that I had set up.

speaker: Roz
text: [_enjoying this greatly_] And don't forget the diamond bracelet you gave me. _Everyone responds with "Awwws" all around.  Denise looks decidedly unhappy._

speaker: Craig
text: I had no idea there was that kind of money in the garbage business.

speaker: Denise
text: [_bitingly, but retaining her grin_] You have no idea about a lot of things.

speaker: Craig
text: What's that supposed to mean?

speaker: Denise
text: Well, why can't you be more like him and do something special for me once in a while?

speaker: Craig
text: [_imitating her grin_] Why can't you be like her and not be such a nag? _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene 8 - Time fade. Frasier and Roz are stepping out of the house onto the porch._

speaker: Roz
text: [_ecstatic_] That was the best half hour I have ever spent with my family!  Thank you!  But what are you doing here?

speaker: Frasier
text: I just had to make sure we were okay.

speaker: Roz
text: I told you we were okay.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, I know, and then you ran away.

speaker: Roz
text: I know, I should have stayed and talked to you.  It's just, usually when I'm freaked out I turn to you, and this time I just didn't feel like I could.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm so sorry.

speaker: Roz
text: For what?

speaker: Frasier
text: For that.  For that evening.  You were vulnerable, and I feel like I took advantage of you.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, Frasier, I'm a grownup, and I make my own decisions. I was just worried that... well, over the years, we've almost gone to bed a couple of times, and we haven't because we were afraid it would damage our friendship.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now we've done it.

speaker: Roz
text: Right.  I was just worried that things would change between us.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's what I came here to ask you.

speaker: Roz
text: I remember the last time I sat here.  Just like this.  My old high school boyfriend sat right where you are, and told me that he had been accepted into college in Boston.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmm.

speaker: Roz
text: And I just stared at his shoelaces.  I was afraid I would cry if I looked anywhere else, you know?  Anyway, we promised that we would always be friends.  It was just the saddest thing in the world because I knew it wasn't true.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_emotionally, clearly worried_] And this time?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, we'll always be friends, Frasier.  Nothing's going to ever change that.

speaker: Roz
text: I can't believe you traveled all this way.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's what people do when they care about someone. _SMASH CUT TO:  Scene 9 - A pub in Manchester, England. Niles walks in the door, looking quite haggard and weary.  He chokes on the smoke and the general smell of the place.  He walks up to the bar._

speaker: Niles
text: Excuse me.  Do you know a man named Harry Moon - and no, that is not the start of a limerick. _The bartender nods to a white-haired gentleman in a cardigan right next to Niles.  As Niles steps back from the bar, Harry puts down his glass and swivels to face Niles._

speaker: Niles
text: Mr. Moon?

speaker: Harry
text: Who's asking?

speaker: Niles
text: My name is Niles Crane.  I'm planning to marry your daughter.

speaker: Harry
text: You look okay to me.  All right, you have my blessing.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you, but actually, I'm here to reunite you with your wife. _Harry's glass freezes on its way to his lips.  He suddenly looks apoplectic.  More strangely, though, Niles realizes that the pub has gone totally silent.  He turns and sees everyone staring at him.  Harry puts down his glass, grabs Niles by the back of his coat and marches him toward the door._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Mr. Moon... Mr. Moon... _Harry violently throws Niles out the door of the pub and returns to his seat at the bar.  FADE OUT  END OF ACT II_
